newsitem.title: USA: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS -- Corporate Earnings. [CORRECTED 22:10 GMT]
newsitem.headline: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS -- Corporate Earnings. [CORRECTED 22:10 GMT]

text.p: General Instrument, off 4-1/8 to 22-3/4

The company reported third-quarter shares earnings of $0.30 a share, compared with a year-ago loss of $0.33 after a charge. It also said it expects fourth-quarter and 1997 earnings to fall below expectations.
UBS Securities downgraded the stock to hold from buy. Its third-quarter estimate had been $0.31.
C.R. Bard, off 1-5/8 to 30-3/4
The company reported third-quarter share earnings fell to $0.20 from $0.25 a year ago. The consensus was $0.46.
SGS-Thomson, up 5-1/4 to 54-3/4 in U.S. trading
The French company reported third-quarter earnings rose seven percent.
Schlumberger Ltd, up 4-1/8 to 98-7/8
The company reported third-quarter share earnings rose to $0.93 from $0.70 a year ago. The First Call consensus was $0.87.
Diebold Inc, up 2-1/8 to 59
The company reported third-quarter share earnings rose to $0.58 from $0.45 a year ago.
Apple Computer, up 1-3/8 to 27

The company reported fourth-quarter share earnings of $0.20, down from $0.48 a year ago. A loss of $0.30 had been expected. The latest quarter included a gain of $0.14 a share for an adjustment in prior period restructuring charges.
Informix, off 2-3/8 to 24-1/8

The company reported third-quarter share earnings rose to $0.17 from $0.16 a year ago. The Zacks mean estimate was $0.18. The year-ago results were restated. CS First Boston and Hambrecht & Quist downgraded the stock.
TCSI Corp, off 5-3/4 to seven
The company reported a third-quarter share loss of $0.31, compared with year-ago profit of $0.11. Alex. Brown cut the stock to neutral from strong buy.
Cirrus Logic, off 2-1/2 to 21-1/2.
The company reported second-quarter share earnings fell to $0.05 from $0.47 a year ago. It reported an operating loss of $0.03, two cents below Wall Street's consensus of a $0.01 per share loss.
(Corrects operating loss figures in above paragraph)
Amrion, off 4-3/8 to 21-1/2
The company reported third-quarter share earnings of $0.22, up from the year-ago's 0.17.
Advanta, off 3-3/8 to 46-1/2

The company reported third-quarter share earnings rose to $0.98 from $0.81 a year ago. The Zacks mean estimate was $0.97. The company said the charge-off rate on managed credit cards was 3.7 percent for the quarter, compared to 3.3 percent in the prior quarter and above the 2.7 percent of a year ago. The managed credit card 30 plus day delinquency rate was 3.9 percent, above the 2.9 percent registered at June 30, and above the 2.3 percent of the year0ago period. The third quarter 1996 figures reflect the adoption of a new bankruptcy charge-off methodology.
Allstate, up 2-1/4 to 53-5/8
The company reported third-quarter operating share earnings of $0.58, compared with the year-ago's $0.90. The First Call consensus was $0.47.
AT&T, off 5/8 to 39-1/4
The company reported third-quarter operating share earnings fell to $0.84 from $0.96 a year ago. The First Call consensus was $0.83.
